nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,24 @@
 Version history
 ---------------
 
+0.3.0 (Mar 26,2020)
+===================
+
+This is the first release of Envoy Mobile we are tagging as production ready 🎉
+
+Since early November, when the team tagged v0.2.0, we have been hard at work to stabilize the library,
+and harden it via experiments with Lyft's Alpha and Beta releases. We have released our production
+binaries with Envoy Mobile for a couple weeks now, and are starting to expose a percentage of our
+production clients to Envoy Mobile with this release.
+
+Since v0.2.3 we have largely focused on observability (#701, #702, #718, #722, #751, #768, #771)

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,24 @@
 Version history
 ---------------
 
+0.3.0 (Mar 26,2020)
+===================
+
+This is the first release of Envoy Mobile we are tagging as production ready 🎉
+
+Since early November, when the team tagged v0.2.0, we have been hard at work to stabilize the library,
+and harden it via experiments with Lyft's Alpha and Beta releases. We have released our production
+binaries with Envoy Mobile for a couple weeks now, and are starting to expose a percentage of our
+production clients to Envoy Mobile with this release.
+
+Since v0.2.3 we have largely focused on observability (#701, #702, #718, #722, #751, #768, #771)
+
+Additional changes:
+
+- Fixes iOS on trailers missing (#703)

nodes.bodyText: I was referring to the callback, but I think this works better

@@ -1,6 +1,24 @@
 Version history
 ---------------
 
+0.3.0 (Mar 26,2020)
+===================
+
+This is the first release of Envoy Mobile we are tagging as production ready 🎉
+
+Since early November, when the team tagged v0.2.0, we have been hard at work to stabilize the library,
+and harden it via experiments with Lyft's Alpha and Beta releases. We have released our production
+binaries with Envoy Mobile for a couple weeks now, and are starting to expose a percentage of our
+production clients to Envoy Mobile with this release.
+
+Since v0.2.3 we have largely focused on observability (#701, #702, #718, #722, #751, #768, #771)
+
+Additional changes:
+
+- Fixes iOS on trailers missing (#703)

nodes.bodyText:
Would it be alright if we downplayed this a bit more? I don't feel comfortable advertising that this is production ready for the general audience.
Maybe something like:
This is the first release of Envoy Mobile we are using in a production application! :tada:
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,6 +1,24 @@
 Version history
 ---------------
 
+0.3.0 (Mar 26,2020)
+===================
+
+This is the first release of Envoy Mobile we are tagging as production ready 🎉

nodes.bodyText: Sure that sounds fine to me. Do you still feel comfortable tagging the release without the pre-release tag? We have done all of our due diligence internally and are using in prod, so I don't see a problem with tagging the release without it

nodes.bodyText: I guess the main concern I have when we say that this is ready for production and in our next minor release, we have a patch for a very blaring issue we discovered in prod
